descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The Cell Processes Laboratory is a hypothesis driven, discovery based laboratory class. During the quarter, students will be be engaged in a laboratory research project where they will design and implement their own experiments centered around understanding a particular disease. Various laboratory techniqes will be introduced to help answer fundamental aspects of cell biological process that are involved in disease development.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
To learn experimental techniques and proper implementation of laboratory protocols
To learn the proper methods to design and test experimental hypotheses using a model system
To draw conclusions from analyzed experimental data and explain potential problems

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
Class participation
Group work
Research project
Writing assignments
Films / videos
Laboratory exercises

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Class materials such as video presentations and scientific articles will be provided by the instructor and will be accessible through Canvas. No additional course materials will required from students.
